meanings.definition: A feeling of resentment or ill-will
meanings.sent1: Her spites towards her classmates stemmed from jealousy.
meanings.sent2: His spites towards his brother were evident in his cold glares.
meanings.sent3: Despite their spites, they managed to work together on the project.
meanings.sent4: The spites between the two rival teams fueled their competitive spirit.
meanings.sent5: The lingering spites between the neighbors made the atmosphere tense.

meanings.definition: To treat with spite or malice
meanings.sent1: She spites her enemies by ignoring their messages.
meanings.sent2: He spites his coworkers by spreading rumors about them.
meanings.sent3: The cat spites the dog by stealing its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The villain spites the hero by destroying everything he loves.
meanings.sent5: The witch spites the villagers by casting a spell on their crops.

meanings.definition: An instance of spiteful or malicious behavior

meanings.sent2: The spites of the gossip led to hurt feelings among friends.
meanings.sent3: The spites of the prankster always kept everyone on edge.
